result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen D. Craigen Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephen D. Craigen Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephen D. Craigen Jr. was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Stephen D. Craigen Jr. was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  May Not have contact with Maggie G unless otherwise permitted by the court.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Complete all other programming, as deemed appropriate by the Compas Assessment and the Dept of Corrections.
State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Mark Richards.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Count 2-   Defendant is sentenced to 3 1/2 years in the WSP Consecutive to any other sentence; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision.  
Count 3 -  Defendant is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP Consecutive to Count 2; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision. 
State shall have 60 days to determine any restitution.  Court costs & Surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.   DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  No contact with Maggie G. unless permitted by the court.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
